briefdescription.para: Function pointer returning position of source.

detaileddescription.para: Function pointer returning position of source.

briefdescription.para: Function pointer returning position of accelerated body.

detaileddescription.para: Function pointer returning position of accelerated body.

briefdescription.para: Function pointer returning radiation pressure.

detaileddescription.para: Function pointer returning radiation pressure.

briefdescription.para: Vector of functions returning emissivities for all panels.
Vector of functions returning diffuse reflection coefficients for all panels.
Vector of functions returning panel surface normal functions.

detaileddescription.para: Vector of functions returning panel surface normal function, in the same frame as the position functions of the accelerated and radiating bodies.

briefdescription.para: Vector of functions returning areas for all panels.
Function pointer returning mass of accelerated body.

detaileddescription.para: Function pointer returning mass of accelerated body.

briefdescription.para: The current accelerations due to the radiation pressure on all single panel.

detaileddescription.para: The current accelerations due to the radiation pressure on all single panel, as calculated by the last call to the updateMembers function

briefdescription.para: Number of panels used in acceleration model.
Current radiation pressure.

detaileddescription.para: Current radiation pressure, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function

briefdescription.para: Current vector from accelerated body to source.

detaileddescription.para: Current vector from accelerated body to source, as calculated by the last call to the updateMembers function

briefdescription.para: The current distance from the accelerated body to the source body.

detaileddescription.para: The current distance from the accelerated body to the source body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function (i.e. norm of the current vector from accelerated body to the source)

briefdescription.para: Current mass of accelerated body.

detaileddescription.para: Current mass of accelerated body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function

briefdescription.para: Current total acceleration due to radiation pressure on set of modelled panels.

detaileddescription.para: Current total acceleration due to radiation pressure on set of modelled panels, as calculated by the last call to the updateMembers functio

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > sourcePositionFunction, const std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > acceleratedBodyPositionFunction, const std::vector< std::function< double() > > &panelEmissivittyFunctions, const std::vector< std::function< double() > > &panelDiffuseReflectionCoefficientFunctions, const std::vector< std::function< Eigen::Vector3d() > > &panelSurfaceNormalFunctions, const std::vector< std::function< double() > > &panelAreaFunctions, const std::function< double() > radiationPressureFunction, const std::function< double() > massFunction)
memberdef.name: PanelledRadiationPressureAcceleration

briefdescription.para: Constructor for setting up the acceleration model, with separate input variables for all required data.

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor for setting up the acceleration model, with separate input variables for all required data.
sourcePositionFunction
Function providing current position for the source body (i.e. the body from which the radiation originates)
acceleratedBodyPositionFunction
Function providing current position for the body on which the force is acting
panelEmissivittyFunctions
Vector of functions returning emissivities for all panels
panelDiffuseReflectionCoefficientFunctions
Vector of functions returning diffuse reflection coefficients for all panels
panelSurfaceNormalFunctions
Vector of functions returning panel surface normal function, in the same frame as the position functions of the accelerated and radiating bodies.
panelAreaFunctions
Vector of functions returning areas for all panels
radiationPressureFunction
Function returning the current radiation pressure (i.e. incident flux, in W/m^2, divided by speed of light)
massFunction
Function returning the current mass of the body being accelerated

memberdef.argsstring: (const std::shared_ptr< PanelledRadiationPressureInterface > radiationPressureInterface, const std::function< double() > massFunction)
memberdef.name: PanelledRadiationPressureAcceleration

briefdescription.para: Constructor for setting up the acceleration model, with input RadiationPressureInterface (and massFunction)

detaileddescription.para:
Constructor for setting up the acceleration model, with input RadiationPressureInterface (and massFunction). The massFunction is only used to convert force to acceleration. All radiation pressure properties are taken from the RadiationPressureInterface object.
radiationPressureInterface
Object in which radiation pressure properties of accelerated body due to radiation from body causing acceleration is stored.
massFunction
Function returning the current mass of the body being accelerated

briefdescription.para: Get radiation pressure acceleration.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the panelled radiation pressure acceleration. No arguments are passed to this function. Instead, all data required for computation is to be obtained from pointers to functions/ classes/structs, etc which are to be set in a derived class and evaluated by the updateMembers() function below.
acceleration.

briefdescription.para: Update member variables used by the radiation pressure acceleration model.

detaileddescription.para: Updates member variables used by the acceleration model. This function evaluates all dependent variables to the 'current' values of these parameters. Only these current values, not the function-pointers are then used by the getAcceleration( ) function.

briefdescription.para: Returns the function returning the current mass of the body being accelerated.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the function returning the current mass of the body being accelerated.
Function returning the current mass of the body being accelerated.

briefdescription.para: Returns the current normalized vector from the accelerated body to the source body.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current normalized vector from the accelerated body to the source body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function
The current normalized vector from the accelerated body to the source body

briefdescription.para: Returns the current distance from the accelerated body to the source body.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current distance from the accelerated body to the source body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function (i.e. norm of the current vector from accelerated body to the source)
The current distance from the accelerated body to the source body

briefdescription.para: Returns the current acceleration due to the radiation pressure on a single panel.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current acceleration due to the radiation pressure on a single panel, as calculated by the last call to the updateMembers function
panelIndex
Index of panel for which acceleration is to be retrieved
The current acceleration due to the radiation pressure on a single panel

briefdescription.para: Returns the current surface normal in propagation frame of a single panel.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current surface normal in propagation frame of a single panel, as calculated by the last call to the updateMembers function
panelIndex
Index of panel for which acceleration is to be retrieved
The current surface normal in propagation frame of a single panels

briefdescription.para: Returns the current radiation pressure at the accelerated body.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current radiation pressure at the accelerated body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function (i.e. incident flux, in W/m^2, divided by speed of light)
The current radiation pressure at the accelerated body

briefdescription.para: Returns the current mass of the accelerated body.

detaileddescription.para:
Returns the current mass of the accelerated body, as set by the last call to the updateMembers function
The current mass of the accelerated body

briefdescription.para: Class for calculating the radiation pressure acceleration on a panelled body.

detaileddescription.para: Class for calculating the radiation pressure acceleration on a panelled body, with the force due to each panel calculated from its area, orientation and emissivity. The emissivity determines the fraction that is absorbed (modelled as a force in line with the vector to th source) and one from reflection (modelled as a force normal to the panel).
